												I've been playing these games since the very beginning, and played 4 when I was testing it on deviantart. This is by far the best one yet, even if I do miss some of the sweet equipment from 3.Very funny game, charming with a sweet array of enemies and abilities for each character, plus a fourth character that isn't in any previous game. (Not-So) Subtle references abound to various other games and anime, and the steam version adds features that even earlier versions of the same game did not have. Quite similar to the classic 90's RPG games, you'll think final fantasy primarily. And like any good Turn Based RPG, it's a thinker's game, great for those who love attention to tactics. I'd reccomend any of these games, any day, play the earlier ones for free, and drop a little cash for this one. Thumbs up~

content:
Posted: February 14, 2015
												Very tight combat mechanics with a lot of interacting skills, status effects, and equipment.  The depth of customization here is stupendous.  It keeps the combat fresh and only becomes tedious near the end if you need to power-level your way up to handle the extremely formidable bosses.  Interesting characters, tons of loot, and the diverse combat mechanics keep the game engaging all the way to the end.Graphics are anime-style rendered in a flash engine.  Not exactly crysis, but it doesn't want to be, and it fits the feel of the game perfectly.The dialogue is humorous - adolescent and boob-focused, but again, this game doesn't care about that and neither should you.  It knows what it wants to be and does it great.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
												I recommend the entire Epic Battle Fantasy series, especially this one and Epic Battle Fantasy 3, almost solely on the wit that Matt Roszak put in these turn-based RPG games.Epic Battle Fantasy 4 introduces a new character to the party in the previous installment. It also adds even more humorous wit, clever allusions and references, and allegory that sets EBF apart from other RPGs. It plays like an RPG: you have a party; you can select which enemies on the world map to attack; you collect equipment, items (coffee to revive dead players, pizza and other foodstuffs to restore health, etc.), and gold ("chocolate coins"); and you beat bosses. Any more details would be spoilers, so play it for yourself!Play the previous games first (they're free on various online game portals) to get the story, but don't miss out on EBF4, which is too clever to pass on.

content:
Posted: January 10, 2016
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a fantastic RPG game that is very enjoyable for several reasons, of which include the large amount of customization that offers thousands of strategies, and the addition of destroying a whole lot of enemies. The aptly Battle Mountain contains battles that will test your strength, and reward you. I enjoy the series, and this installment is just about the very best so far, at least until Epic Battle Fantasy 5 comes out. If you enjoy a fun RPG game that isn't too serious, lots of ways to obliterate your foes and just a plain good time, this is the right game for you. Of course, the interface is not the easiest to navigate, and the lack of a tutorial is a bit messed-up, but before you try this game, you should try the Flash version of it, to see if you would want to spend money on it.

content:
Posted: December 24, 2015
												Been playing the since the first Epic Battle Fantasy on Kongregate.com. Was not disappointed by this.You will play as 4 characters each with their own themes and skills that match. You start with 1 and quickly collect the rest of your party.Minor spoiler for party formation if you play previous games:  You start as the new game character instead of any of the original characters. Combat is really simple yet can be indept. There are attacks and spells, buffs and debuffs, resistances and weaknesses. Enemies have attack patterns which can be predictable at times.There are numerous pots. Equipment wise, you can equip a weapon, a headgear (hat), an armor, and 3 flairs (badges for small bonuses). While you can not craft any items, you can upgrade them to improve their existing stats and sometimes add new ones.Story is cheeky and predictable. Humor is the same as previous games.Overall buy it if you like a decent rpg.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: June 24, 2015
												EBF 4 is a turn-based RPG inspired by games like Final Fantasy and Golden Sun. It's the first of the series to be on steam, as the others were browser games on websites like Kongregate and Armor Games. I  remember playing one of the EBF games, although I don't remember which one. I don't remember much, so I wasn't sure what to expect.There are quite a few unique mechanics in EBF 4. First, the backup mechanic requires one of your four people to be in "backup", and therefore not fighing, who can be switched in without using a turn. At first I hated the mechanic, but I grew attached to it and it does make for some interesting situations. Second, when you win a battle, you get AP. This is how you obtain and upgrade skills, as not a single skill is learned through leveling. Skills in the "special" catagory can be learned by two or more different party members, but only one can actually learn it. For example, Anna and Natalie can both learn heal, but if Natalie knows it, then Anna can't. Which, I recommend you do just that, but that's just what I do.There is also "waves" system where if a battle has three waves, you have to clear out three screens worth of enemies. This is backed by the fact that all enemies are on the map, and you can engage them at any time and flee at any time, with the only punishment for flee being that the hurt or killed enemies reset.One of the things I love about this game is that both hardcore RPG fans and newcomers to RPG's can both enjoy the game. There are ten elements and twelve status effects, every enemy has unique resistances and weaknesses to elements, statuses, and debuffs, your party's weapons give them elemental normal attacks and armor give elements and status resists and weaknesses, a complex upgrading system with a large array of crafting materials, and the HUGE amount of skills is insane! We've got buff spells, debuff spells, elemental spells, partially elemental and partially physical, spells that damage and may caused status effects, spells that damage and may debuff enemies, spells that take away enemy buffs, take away your team's debuffs, limit breaks, spells that element changes depending on the weapon you use, spells that power up in certain conditions, spells with lots of power but debuff your character, HOLY CRAP, I'm geeking out! At the same time though, the first time you use a certain spell, or get hit by a certain attack one of your characters says some, whether it be funny (most of the time because the spell speaks for itself and doesn't require explanation), or it be important information like saying the Barrier and Heal More spells are really important (which they are probably the game's two most important spells.)Graphically, the overworld looks much different than the battle graphics, but both serve their part well. The story isn't impressive, but it certainly gets the job done, especially considering the game is lighthearted and never takes itself too seriously. Until the final boss. That's some dark crap right there. Also, I feel the need to say this. I won't spoil anything, but I had Anna and Natalie at 31, Lance and Matt at 32, and didn't even use Lance. I changed my armor sets according to the different forms for maximum effieciency. The fight took me an hour, no joke. Speaking of the final boss, the music in the game is great. Not Shovel knight is Mega man levels of great, but pretty close in my opinion. Oh yea. The final boss theme is great. The game's lighthearted theme and humor is one of the things that kept me engaged. I loved laughing the hilarious and silly dialogue, as it just added a unique spice to the battles.If I had to find some complaints I had, they would be few, but the one big issue I had that there is a bunch of optional content, and I wanted to do as much as possible, but it just wasn't as interesting as the main quest. There is a whole bonus area with upgraded versions of the bosses in the main story, but fighting the same enemy with better numbers and a few more tricks just... isn't engaging as fighting them for the first time. But the big kicker that killed my motivation for the bonus area was that you don't get any EXP, AP, or gold from the fight. If I got even a little, I might have gone a bit farther, but I didn't even feel up to getting past the second boss.Overall though, it's amazing. Definetly in my Top 20 or maybe 15 favorite games I've played. Top 10 would be a bit of a stretch, but it's possible. Get it if you are a hardcore RPG fan or want to start getting into RPG's. I mean, I've played RPGs ever since I was 6, I know a good RPG when I see one. And this is a good RPG.TL;DR Read the last few sentences.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: July 14, 2015
												Look, if you've seen this game's trailer, and seen anything you liked, or even just had the time to look through the screenshots and said "Hey, this game looks like it might be good.", please just go and buy this game. If you love Final Fantasy, or Chrono Trigger, or Golden Sun, or really any rpg ever I almost guarentee that there is something here for you. The story, while geared more toward the 12-25 age range, is still an enjoyable, simple story that lays itself out nicely throughout the story. The gameplay flows very well, and it is very easy to notice that there was time put into making the characters and abilities balanced and scale throughout the game. While the game can be very easy when using the corresponding elemental rock,paper,scissors equipment to fight enemies, the battles can still be very long and challenging, making the title of "Epic Battle" very evident, especially on epic mode. The art is very well done, and the music fits the game incredibly.It's also important to note that the other three games in the series are FREE online, so if you want a primer to what you will be getting you can go play those aswell, which I would also recommend.All in all, this game, and this series, was a great effort by Matt Rosak and HalcyonicfalconX. Fantastic job, and can't wait for Bullet Heaven 2!

content:
Posted: August 4, 2016
												In a sentence: Simple, but tons of fun. It's a basic RPG in the old school turn-based style, but a well-crafted one and full of charm. Great entry point for those inexperienced in turn-based JRPGs and curious to try them out, because of it's simplicity: Everything about the game is easy to grasp and satisfying to master. The combat and customization will never get you lost and yet decisions are not entirely brainless, the exploration is rewarding and backtracking never feels like a chore, the level and grinding curve is done just right. Seasoned veterans of the RPG genre may find it too basic, and they'd be right, but even them can find something to love about this game.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 25, 2016
												I recommend the entire Epic Battle Fantasy series, especially this one and Epic Battle Fantasy 3, almost solely on the wit that Matt Roszak put in these turn-based RPG games.Epic Battle Fantasy 4 introduces a new character to the party in the previous installment. It also adds even more humorous wit, clever allusions and references, and allegory that sets EBF apart from other RPGs. It plays like an RPG: you have a party; you can select which enemies on the world map to attack; you collect equipment, items (coffee to revive dead players, pizza and other foodstuffs to restore health, etc.), and gold ("chocolate coins"); and you beat bosses. Any more details would be spoilers, so play it for yourself!Play the previous games first (they're free on various online game portals) to get the story, but don't miss out on EBF4, which is too clever to pass on.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: August 21, 2016
												Biased review ahead.I've been playing Kupo's games for years, since the very first Epic Battle Fantasy game. I've completed every single one - and most, more than once.With all that said, allow me to attempt to explain why this game is good:-Elemental attacks\resists system is very intuitive. Very much an old-school JRPG system.-Multiple difficulty levels, with the easiest one being 50% enemy stats and various attacks weakened to allow the weakest players a chance to progress anyway. Meanwhile, the most difficult setting gives enemies 200% stats and allows them to use their nastiest attacks, making for a real challenge.-Can be played for free on Kongregate for a try, if you're uncertain. The paid version not only supports the author but also includes a miniboss and boss marathon, as well as some new bosses to challenge players.-Everything in this game is beautifully drawn and totally adorable in every way; from the legless cats to the slimes to the shrubs and even the characters.-Jokes are well spaced out, and the game doesn't break the fourth wall too often to devalue it.-Multiple skills and abilities allow for varied strategies.-Good clock-time, with new game plus and new game plus plus to extend it even further for those hungry for more.Now, the cons - for almost every game has some. They are nit-picks, though:-The game has permanent stat boosting items, and while you have four characters only three are active at a time. This means that the most effective strategy is to dump all the stat boosts on three characters and leave the fourth as backup permanently.-Eventually your strategy will devolve into buffing your party, debuffing the enemy party and using one big all-target skill or spell for an attempted instant kill. You will be using different skills for different elemental types, though.-The higher difficulties don't offer increased experience\item\skill point rewards, despite taking at least four times as long (enemies have 200% health on hardest, to the 50% on easiest). This means most players will usually fight trash mobs on easiest and only fight the bosses on the hardest. Even that, only once, for the achievements.-The game has some of the "but I might need it later" with one of it's consumables (chilli bottle, which refills the limit break bar of a character).-The huge variety in gear does lend to some very slight inventory management, mostly just before bosses.I absolutely love this game. 9/10.-Sleepy

												Let me start by saying it's definitely not worth full price, this just doesn't have enough content over the free version that's been available for years to be worth anywhere near $10. I got it for about $2.50 and at that price I heartily recommend it. Anyone who likes turn based fights like FF or Pokemon will enjoy this. The humor isn't bad although there are a lot of running jokes from the previous games, so if you're not into the series you probably won't be into this. 100% achievements in 25 hours pretty damn good for a flash game. Only downsides are some performance issues due to being flash (usually can be fixed with a restart) and low replayability once you've done everything in the game once. NG+ is more of a grind for an achievement than a chance to play around with early enemies with end game skills and gear since the enemies scale with you from start to finish.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: November 30, 2014
												I've been a fan of the Epic Battle Fantasy since I first found the original on Newgrounds five years ago. Seeing the series evolve as much as it has, finally reaching an actual release on Steam? It's a great sight.I've never been a fan of JRPGs, but I never found EBF to be frustratingly difficult. It requires the right enough amount of micromanagement, planning, and strategy to appeal to both casual and hardcore RPG players. It's also got a very parody-minded sense of humor that's usually quite fun and rarely runs dry. One example in it's favor is South Park: The Stick of Truth, which I did like for it's humor, but the tongue-in-cheek delivery kind of killed it for me halfway. EBF doesn't do that, and I'm glad about that.While my only real complaint would be the relative lack of backstory to cover the events of past games for those who might be new to these games, it's never so drawn out and overly complicated to not pick up on quickly. If you're looking for a new RPG to add to your library, I'd definitely make no higher recommendations.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 21, 2016
												Best RPG combat system I've played in my life (have played about 40 RPGs). This game is not easy and you really have to think and understand it to play on harder difficulties (and you must min-max to win on hardest), but you can enjoy lower difficulty without much thought if you prefer to just have fun. About 50-100 hours of content. Fun and detailed art style, TONS of personality, a lot of scenario variety, and lots of humor.  I haven't had this much fun playing an RPG since I was a kid playing FFX. I cannot recommend this game highly enough. I strongly suggest you stop reading, buy this game (small file-size) and if for some reason you aren't wholly, ridiculously and entirely entertained... well, you can just refund it then (unlikely scenario).

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: December 19, 2016
												This is a very fun indie RPG.  It's light hearted, cheeky dialogue and enemies are very memorable and endearing.  I've played it through 4 full times and haven't gotten sick of it yet.Pros:- The music is unbelievably good.  Phyrnna (the composer) is up there with the best in the business.  While the game is great, the single most impressive aspect is the music.- The underlying battle system is very well balanced and expansive.  Tons of skills, summons, items, weapons, variety and it also works well.  You don't find yourself having to rely on the same tactic over and over.  Different enemies require different tactics.- The dialogue is really enjoyable.  Many, many hilarious lines in this game.- Nice variety of achievements to add replay value.- Characters have strong personalities and are very unique.  Quite memorable.- Puzzles are fun, not too common and well designed.- The game itself is nicely designed and does a good job of rewarding you for searching for secrets (hidden treasures and stuff, nothing super important)Cons:- Can feel a bit grindy at times especially when you get to the battles that have 3 waves.  Fortunately amazing music is there to take the edge off.- Not enough reason to utilize your 4th character.  It's too easy to just park Lance in the back up slot and never use him.  He's a fun character, but Anna is the better support character since she has access to the party defense up and reflex up buffs.  Lance just can't keep up with her and thus gets overlooked for important battles.Overall:This is unquestionably a fun, well made game.  The game knows what it is trying to be and pulls it off extraordinarily well.  Kupo Games is a one man, independent studio who puts out high quality games at good prices.  For the price, this game is a no brainer.  I couldn't recommend it more strongly!

content:
Posted: March 2, 2015
												Epic battle fantasy 4 was actually the best game I've played all year, hands down. Balanced but challenging gameplay, witty humor and a ton of innuendoes all thrown together into one RPG is a once in a lifetime game. I really enjoyed the strategy to it, especially the weapon and armor system. In EBF4, There isnt such thing as endgame armor or weapons. Its all balanced. The sword you start out with on matt will be useful for some battles, but not all. Likewise, a shiny new sword from a hard dungeon might be great at taking out certain foes, but not much else. The same goes for the games armor. Overall I give it a 10/10, and I highly reccomend it. Easily worth the cheap price tag. To be honest I'd say it worth much more. If you like a fun engaging game with a lot of references and jokes, pick it up!

												A highly polished gem that takes the older Final Fantasy battle system, and does it really right. ProsThe battle system - Highly polished. Enemies can attack in waves. number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: April 13
One of the most enjoyable turn based strategy games I have played8/10Status: Playing - 15 hrsWorth The Price?: $12.99 is a solid price for the amount of content packed into this game, the game is clearly crafted with love.PROS:-LOTS of skills, weapons, gear & enemies-Catchy soundtrack-Unique style and nice effects-*click on the boobs meme that the developer loves being written about* -Fun puzzles-CatsCONS:-Exhaustingly repetative at times, feels like stuff is reused and crammed in to prolong the game making some levels painfully slow to progress-The character swap out mechanic. This is a very personal con as this is just something I don't like in these type of games, I want to level up and grow my teams strength and not have to worry about who has to sit it out and gain nothing. Needless to say Lance keeps the bench nice and warm the whole game-It seems like there are a lot of useless skills that you would never useI have played most games in this series since they were free browser games, I enjoyed them enough to grab this one on steam. I really enjoy the Epic Battle fantasy games for their charming humor, unique design and the sense of adventure and wonder it gives, keeping me excited for what is on the next screen or what new interesting treasure is in that chest just out of reach. The CONS I listed above do bother me, but the PROS outweigh them. I look forward to the next in the series and seeing how it is tweaked to come even closer to god cat status.

content:
Posted: January 16
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a good, even great, JRPG that nails the Final fantasy style of game in an indie package pretty damn well. First and foremost it´s extremely flashy and looks great thanks to constant lively animations, vibrant colours and a ton of variety. The combat is engaging enough to keep up the pace and as the game progresses one does need to start paying more and more attention to elemental strengths/weaknesses, though it doesn´t get overly complex at any point(at least on the first playthrough).The structure of the game carries it and exploring the world opening treasure chests, new story bits, talking to people and beating some mosnters is blast all the way through. The humour works with some stuff landing, some not but the tone is consistent and enjoyable. That said it´s worth keeping in mind that this is very much a full-blown JRPG first and a comedy-game second. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is both proudly part of the genre and makes fun of the funny parts of it, exaclty as a good comedy-game should be.All and all I couldn´t really recommend this game more for anyone feeling like playing a solid and pretty as hell JRPG

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19
												As a direct sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy 3, this games improves on pretty much every aspect of the previous entry in the series. You liked the previous one and want more ? You'll like this one.If you haven't, you can start by playing the others but it is by no mean necessary. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a basic Rpg made by one man and although it sometimes shows, the game is worth playing if you can get past a few things. Those things will change depending on the player. I, for instance, had to get over the graphics that feel extremely simple, the humor that can be plain or corny sometimes, and maybe the length of the fights toward the end. But once again, those might be assets to some peolpe.What else is there ? The game is quite long ( about 25-30 hours ), it's got some depth to it that goes beyond enemy weaknesses / resistances, and overall you have fun most of the time you spend in the game if you get hooked. It's honestly still quite impressive for a one-man-game. Plus there's post-game content !For the price it's at, if you like the rpg genre, and if you have nothing better at the moment, this will definitely be worth your time as a filler while you wait for another release.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 23
												The story is silly and funny. It's full of little intenet speech and memes references.The big thing that has me recommend this game though is the combat system. It is hands down one of the single best turn based combat systems I have EVER played. I have been playing RPGs for over 20 years, hundreds of them completed. This not small praise. It's an excellent system.Unlike many RPGs, elemental effects actually matter. Ever single enemy has elemental weaknesses to take advantage of. All your weapons (bar a few non-elemental ones) have elements that deal damage of its type and buff spells of its type.The game actively encourages you to swap equipment mid-combat to take advantage of the situation. Giving yourself over 100% resistance to an element will allow you to be HEALED by that element! More than once I've had all my team with close to, if not over, 100% resistance and the normally very strong enemy deals pathetic amounts of damage.I cannot recommend this enough if you love RPGs and especially love good combat systems.

												tl;dr - if you can deal with the performance problems and like JRPGs definitely worth a playthough but expect frequent disruption even on top-end systems.Pros - Good JRPG style game. Includes all the typical trope along with a unique plot (sort of - team up and save the world, JRPG style) and likeable characters. Very fun and funny game, easy to learn and a ton of stuff to do. Decent but not great controls.Cons - None with the content or gameplay. Better controls would be helpful but not a big deal. Only real issue was frequent performance problems (the reason I stopped playing). With no resource pressure game frequently lags during combat and screen transitions. Searching the web, this is a common issue. It's apparently a side effect of translating from a Flash game to an exe and the dev can't do anything about it. The issue becomes increasingly more frustrating as you advance - the longer a fight is, the more frequently you'll see framerate drops or even complete freezes that don't correlate to resource contention. Once you get into long fights (post-endgame content) it's not worth the trouble.

content:
Posted: January 16
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a good, even great, JRPG that nails the Final fantasy style of game in an indie package pretty damn well. First and foremost it´s extremely flashy and looks great thanks to constant lively animations, vibrant colours and a ton of variety. The combat is engaging enough to keep up the pace and as the game progresses one does need to start paying more and more attention to elemental strengths/weaknesses, though it doesn´t get overly complex at any point(at least on the first playthrough).The structure of the game carries it and exploring the world opening treasure chests, new story bits, talking to people and beating some mosnters is blast all the way through. The humour works with some stuff landing, some not but the tone is consistent and enjoyable. That said it´s worth keeping in mind that this is very much a full-blown JRPG first and a comedy-game second. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is both proudly part of the genre and makes fun of the funny parts of it, exaclty as a good comedy-game should be.All and all I couldn´t really recommend this game more for anyone feeling like playing a solid and pretty as hell JRPG

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 23
												The story is silly and funny. It's full of little intenet speech and memes references.The big thing that has me recommend this game though is the combat system. It is hands down one of the single best turn based combat systems I have EVER played. I have been playing RPGs for over 20 years, hundreds of them completed. This not small praise. It's an excellent system.Unlike many RPGs, elemental effects actually matter. Ever single enemy has elemental weaknesses to take advantage of. All your weapons (bar a few non-elemental ones) have elements that deal damage of its type and buff spells of its type.The game actively encourages you to swap equipment mid-combat to take advantage of the situation. Giving yourself over 100% resistance to an element will allow you to be HEALED by that element! More than once I've had all my team with close to, if not over, 100% resistance and the normally very strong enemy deals pathetic amounts of damage.I cannot recommend this enough if you love RPGs and especially love good combat systems.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
Posted: February 19
												As a direct sequel to Epic Battle Fantasy 3, this games improves on pretty much every aspect of the previous entry in the series. You liked the previous one and want more ? You'll like this one.If you haven't, you can start by playing the others but it is by no mean necessary. Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a basic Rpg made by one man and although it sometimes shows, the game is worth playing if you can get past a few things. Those things will change depending on the player. I, for instance, had to get over the graphics that feel extremely simple, the humor that can be plain or corny sometimes, and maybe the length of the fights toward the end. But once again, those might be assets to some peolpe.What else is there ? The game is quite long ( about 25-30 hours ), it's got some depth to it that goes beyond enemy weaknesses / resistances, and overall you have fun most of the time you spend in the game if you get hooked. It's honestly still quite impressive for a one-man-game. Plus there's post-game content !For the price it's at, if you like the rpg genre, and if you have nothing better at the moment, this will definitely be worth your time as a filler while you wait for another release.

												Very fun little RPG game.  It's a bit hard to figure out what spells, stats, etc. do since I guess they expect people to have played the earlier ones.  Overall, on normal it also has spikes where you'll be barely thinking and killing battle after battle, then get completely owned in one fight or another, usually boss fights, but not always.  Still great game and the 3rd is free to play on Steam (permenently?) and if you like fairly basic light RPGs it's hard not to love this one.

Posted: January 15
												Epic Battle Fantasy 4 is a Fairly mindless JRPG parody. It's 45% JRPG jokes and 45% Internet memes and 10% random stuff (which could be memes I don't recognize.) The leveling system is just interactive enough to be satisfying. Your characters level linearly but they also accumulate AP to learn and level up skills however you like. Equipment can be leveled up by spending materials you collect. This might be the ideal RPG to play when you're sick.
